title: Add support for exporting symbols in binary

labels.name: A-linkage
labels.description: Area: linking into static, shared libraries and binaries

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

body:
When creating an executable, even if you mark a function pub, the resulting file will not export the function. This is handled by this line:
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/b97e9b5dc74e705cd01603c5f735652a04460a60/src/librustc_codegen_ssa/back/linker.rs#L508
There seems to be no way to get around this, aside from creating a new target with a list of override_symbol_exports, which require manually listing the exports. Not exporting all the symbols makes sense most of the time, but there are situations where one wants to build an executable that supports `GetProcAddress()` (EG for allowing a library with a proc macro to access dynamically generated functions that may/may not exist). It would be nice if there was a build option or similar to make executables export symbols.
